title: Funerary epitaph of P. Sergius Niger
support: A fine light grey marble plaque, with light grey veining. Intact on all sides, with a frame formed by a single moulding; roughly picked only on the reverse.

layout.p: Two lines in the upper portion of the plaque, both lines indented from the left margin, line 2 more so than line 1, but extending fully to the right margin with slight compression.

handNote.lettering: Elegant regular v-cut letters with fairly broad module and elegant serifs. P open, R closed by a very light stroke. Comma-shaped interpuncts.

provenanceFound._: Found in re-use as part of a tombcover in catacomb of S. Maria di Gesu (part of Vigna Cassia), cubicoli N and O of plan of Fuhrer

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2016-06-29
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2016-06-29

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.

bibl.author: Orsi
bibl.title: Contributi alla Sicilia cristiana (Licodia Eubea, Grasullo, Priolo, Siracusa)
